intro: Hemistemma banksii, commonly known as the Banks' hemistemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Hemistemma banksii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained environments.
